GskDfQ5fnXgjwob4s00I0g.text: Ordered the wagu 6oz filet and the new york strip. Asked for medium rare on the filet, medium for the new york, came out as medium well and well done. The place was packed, people running around like their heads cut off. For a fine dining restaurant i expected better. Our waiter was so busy he was pretty much making jokes while walking away from the table.  The restaurant environment is really nice, the price is what you expect for a nice steak house. I just think they were just too understaffed or not prepared for the amount of tables for each server. I felt like i was dining at black angus or outback steakhouse with this service.   Even though the steaks were way overcooked, it was still good. Their bread was pretty delicious.

ngEAOovV9ec-xscICWmBww.text: 5 stars for great attentive service and a very satisfying dinner experience.  Since this was our first time, the chef sent out some appetizers. This gesture was very nice but some select dishes need an acquired taste so we had a hard time trying them.   Ceasar salad was amazing. Simple but glad they got that right. If you like your steak more on the char side, red meat lovers will enjoy themselves.   Great ambience and experience. Thanks!

S7sx93NsjgwIw6SVRZgxnw.text: This review is about the Sterling Buffet, the amazing, high-end, all-you-can-eat, Sunday brunch at BLT.  After having visited once before, the availability of this buffet literally dictated the days of the visit to Las Vegas this go-around.    BOOK MONTHS IN ADVANCE, reservations are tough to get.  Why the huge demand?  I can make a short list.  All-you-can-eat lobster, filets, crab, caviar, sushi.....I could go on for many more lines.  Oh, and bottomless champagne -- PERRIER JOUET at that!  We arrived at our reservation time but still had to wait about 15 minutes.  But we were given our first glasses of champagne at the door.  So, I could have waited a few more minutes!    Once you are seated, a server will bring you water, top off your champagne, explain the buffet layout and you're off to the races.  Round one was stone crab legs, lobster, bacon (just because) and potato and chorizo hash.  Round two was a petite filet, caviar, asparagus and bacon (just because).  I went back for more caviar and some sushi before moving on to the wonderful dessert spread.    The desserts are all petite and gorgeously made encouraging you to try a vast array of flavors and textures.    Are these the creme de la creme examples of each type of food?  No.  But they are very good examples and you can totally glutton out at a buffet in Vegas that doesn't have just roast beef and mashed potatoes as the 'stars'.

cyS_RYpNg-CkGAriGqnyrw.text: Update 2019 It's been years dining here and Leslie never let me down! Great service, super attentive and I can't believe I never mention Leslie in my review.  She definitely deserves a shout out for keeping up with great service all these years!  Josh kept our water glass and drinks filled, constantly checked on us and took empty plates away. Love BLT!

LpsSDBUmx4nFYuqVADiG-Q.text: Celebrated our 13th Anniversary at this wonderful place -great atmosphere , outstanding service from Lupita and the entire meal was perfect - the Tuna Tartar was delicious and steaks perfect - the wife had the flatiron steak w. chimichurri sauce and I had the Filet mignon and lobster.   We ended the night with the pumpkin cheesecake. I would highly recommend this fine steak house.

fw92WQD73zbrCa_OfLHwuQ.text: The waiter acted like I was going to dine and dash!  I arrived at BLT Steak at around 5pm with a friend. At the beginning our waiter was pleasant, but when we didn't order an alcoholic beverage or an appetizer his personality changed. I'm not 21, I can't drink. I'm also around 90 pounds, so the thought of an appetizer on top of a hefty steak was a no go for me.  Our food soon arrived and it was wonderful. The steak was cooked perfectly and their baked potatoes are HUGE! Everything tasted perfect.   Shortly after that, the manager started hovering around our table, and the other waiters and bussers were glaring at us. We looked a little out of place (my friend and I were dressed rather casually) but I thought nothing of it at first.  When I was about half-way down with my steak, I realized the waiter hadn't visited our table in quite awhile. He was busy with the platinum members and more "put together" customers. To be honest I think anyone who has a reservation here should be treated with decency and respect, and not ignored for customers paying more money.   I ended up having to get up from the table and ask the hovering manager where I could find a restroom. They don't have one inside of the restaurant. It was quite a ways away.  While I was gone the waiter asked my friend if I WAS GOING TO COME BACK. He said "because she left her stuff". Uhm yeah left my stuff because I planned on coming back, not because I was dining and dashing.  The only person who didn't treat us differently was one of the bussers, and we made sure to tip him well.   I am extremely disappointed. Doesn't matter if I'm in a fur coat or a shirt and jeans, I had a reservation, and I have every right to be there.  I will not be visiting this location again. Shame on everyone working here.

hD4jA5BzUusl1eEtt1reBg.text: Visited BLT Steak on 1.24.19.  It was a pleasant experience with excellent service.  I ordered my go to meal starting with the crab cake appetizer.  I followed that up with a 6oz American Wagyu Filet paired with a nice Pinot Noir.  My side was mashed potatoes.  All in all it was a pretty good steak dinner.  It was a bit pricey to me, but that's only because I had pretty much the same meal 2 nights later for half the price.  The Wagyu was good... much like the A5 Kobe; I was a little underwhelmed.  The crab cake was delicious.  Although I'm not a fan of the radish salad.  The potatoes were great!  The paired wine was excellent as well.  Again, the service was impeccable.  Attentive without being intrusive...

Pl8hOIX3iwJGclGUPh6bSg.text: Everyone knows there's a lot of steakhouses in Vegas!! Every casino, every corner!! Hard to choose, I know. I did some research and "traveled" from the Mandalay Bay, where I was staying to Bally's for BLT...AND it was well worth it!! I had the 16oz NY strip and a nice sized baked potato. The build it yourself side cart that comes with the baked potato is a very nice touch!! The steak was unbelievable and the service was fantastic. They also have these complementary beard rolls, called "popovers" and it was ridiculously good with the honey butter and sea salt!! I didn't take a picture of it, because I was starving and had no time for pics!! There's plenty of pictures of them on here from other yelpers. This place is very good people, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this steakhouse.

gamqBA8R15LFMpedo-o2xQ.text: We had an Anniversary dinner on our last night in Vegas. My wife ordered the Steak 8 ounces and I ordered the Lamb and it came with green beans or mashed potatoes my wife said the steak was OK but it was not nothing special and the lamb wasn't that well cooked as I asked for it to be well done now I was checking in on yelp and it got a free drink $16 drink at that this meal was $175 and out bags down the street was just as good if not better the waitress here was fantastic we told her it was our anniversary she brought two glasses of champagne and some dessert popsicle and brownie pieces which was very nice of her but you would think you would get more from an upscale restaurant.  With so many choices in Las Vegas, we probably will not return

HJ4dQnD3CwG0vWf7vAot2w.text: The Sterling Brunch served at BLT Steak inside Bally's Hotel and Casino on Sunday mornings is surely a five star affair. A reservation is highly recommended because this brunch is so popular and delightful that you may not get in without one. We made ours weeks in advance and were super excited on the day we visited.   The experience is drenched in luxurious pampering as servers dressed in tuxedos begin your service with a pop of a cork and what turns out to be endless pours of Perrier Jouet champagne, accompanied by orange juice if you like. Next, comes the "popovers" which are supersized warm from the oven yeast rolls that melt in your mouth with cream butter. You are then invited to visit the buffet station where you are overwhelmed by omelets made to order, hand carved Nueske's bacon, filet mignon, lobster tails, king crab legs, slow roasted prime rib, lobster ravioli, grilled salmon, fresh made sushi, chilled shrimp, oysters on the half shell, and more. You enjoy all you can eat as your server continues to remove your empty plates and top off you champagne flute.   Finally before you get too full you breeze by the dessert table where you have your choice of bite size sweets and delicacies including flan, cheesecake, chocolate mousse in mini martini glasses and cake pops. As you throw your crisp cloth napkin on your plate and push yourself away from the table, you realize that you are so well pleased that you vow to tell all your friends and family and the entire Yelp community about this splendid experience at the best brunch you've ever had. And you swear that you have to try BLT Steak for dinner sometime.

DT5WXHsczRIfOra3lh_CGQ.text: Visited here with a group of friends for a bachelor party and found the coupon on Travelzoo. The coupon stated we had to get certain things but the waiter said we were allowed to just spend until we hit our limit. Our table went with an assortment of appetizers, steak,seafood, and different desserts. I started with popover bread and lobster and shrimp seasonal cake. Popover was light and very well baked. The cake was different but very fresh. Forgot what the sauce was but it was amazing!   The steaks were cooked perfectly. I went with the bone in ribeye. The waiter mistakenly put the wrong order in so by the time I got my steak my table was finished eating but it was worth the wait. The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare and seasoned beautifully. I had an order of mashed potatoes and they were good nothing to rave about but good.  We ended up trying out about every drink on the menu and I'll be the first to say there were no bad ones. Old Cuban, BLT Cocktail, and Jagged Edge were great!   Besides a couple hiccups food was amazing! If you're thinking about it do it and I'd suggest the coupon which is very useful! Will be visiting again next time I'm in town!

RJAUZvpuMrEAhUBPu_pTFg.text: I very rarely leave anything but 5 star reviews.. yet this place deserves 1 star. Had dinner here on Saturday night with my sweetheart on a spontaneous weekend getaway. Table for two, and they put us in the darkest furthest corner of the place. Lupita was our server. Rather than tell us about the place, or about the food, or about the specials, she merely handed us a paper menu and walked away. Meanwhile at another table close to us, another male server was describing how things were cooked, he explained the specials, etc. We felt like the red headed stepchildren set in the corner! We didn't realize that no side dishes accompanied the entrees. We ordered mashed potatoes that arrived looking like a bowl full of grey glue. They were not good, yet no one bothered to ask how they were when they picked up the full dish later.  We also ordered dessert. We asked questions about one of the specials and our server seemed too bothered to answer them. Then she brought out a dish with tiny bites of cake pops and brownie bites, but she didn't explain they were different flavors. One was a peanut butter bite.. thank goodness we didn't have a peanut allergy!  I'm giving one star here because the steaks were actually cooked perfectly and the gentleman who filled our water glasses was very attentive and pleasant. So I guess it wasn't a colossal waste of time. But what should have been a romantic dinner in an upscale restaurant became annoying and certainly not worth the expense.  This place does a Sunday breakfast, and we thought maybe we'd give this place another try, we thought maybe we just caught them on a bad night, since we observed the other dinner table having such good service. Unfortunately, the next morning the hostess seemed too busy when we arrived, telling us we could just find a spot to sit in the bar. We asked if we wanted a table how long the wait would be. She seemed very put out that she had to go look at the dining area, and came back and said "uhh maybe like I don't know around 40 minutes". For $100+ per person for breakfast, and her unprofessional and unenthusiastic attitude, it was very easy for us to decide to go elsewhere.  We really wanted to love this place. The steaks were fantastic. The popovers were also delicious. Everything else was mediocre at best. Certainly this was the very worst service we experienced the entire trip.

7o4jl8jlynt2Vikl10Qpxw.text: First time here and loved it. You won't be disappointed trust me. I ordered the Caesar salad, filet minion and some Hen-of-the-woods-mushrooms. So amazing..  Ohh I have to mention how good the bread was mmmmm.  Service was also amazing!!!

4GWXAtqkea5CrI0LLJMLxg.text: This place was off the hook!! Coming from Cali, I've been to the best steakhouses (Mastros, Morton's, Ruth's Chris) and this restaurant was right up there. The Crabcakes are the best I've ever had, and they are a generous size which was a bonus. Oysters were tasty. Filet Mignon was so tender and tasty! Although it is inside Bally's, the restaurant ambience was upscale. (We called ahead and they said pants required.) Oh wait.. almost forgot about the bread! It is a popover bakes with gruyere cheese.. melt in your mouth bread. I would come just to try this again! We will definitely be coming back!   Thanks Rudy for treating us to some beautiful pre appetizer plates. The meats were delicious!

B_hcgHOQQJugYTu6hcmLvA.text: Went to BLT with my boyfriend recently. We had a great experience. The ambiance was nice and mellow. The food: He ordered the NY Strip medium well. It was delicious. I tasted it lol He loved it. It was well seasoned and tender. I ordered the braised beef short ribs. I did not love it. The meat was not tender and not as well seasoned as the NY strip. We shared the macaroni and cheese and the onion rings. The mac and cheese was very flavorful. I didn't love the onion ring batter, it was smooth. I prefer the batter crispy and crunchy but that's a personal preference.  My boyfriend loved everything. I thought it was okay, although I did love the NY strip.  The Poppers (bread) were quite delicious.  I would definitely return to BLT.

YHe88BhN96T_zz5Oz5wlfg.text: This is my go-to steak house in Vegas. Steaks are incredible, drinks are always spot on, service is impeccable (ask for Javier), and those popovers are definitely going to be served non-stop when I die and go to heaven!

Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone - In - Strip

ECBaL5oxfBQljikzTrLvXw.text: Came here with my love the last night of our vacation. It's a very romantic atmosphere. It's a bit on the pricey side( $30-$70 a plate) but well worth it. Our server was Javier, was amaizing. They gave us a delicious cheese bread, it was like nothing else I've tasted before, and they give you the recipe so you can make it at home. I recommend the short ribs, plenty of meat that's braised in wine..yumm... and around $40 for the plate; sides are a la carte but, for example, one side of mashed potatoes is more than enough for two people, so if you're trying to keep it economical that's a good thing to remember.

jaKnqWEFyUcj2F0TiVqOzg.text: Excellent! Ambience energetic. Lamb was superb. There is a Sommelier. Salmon and steak was excellent. No complaints with good customer service. Only thing is ... pricey... but worth it.

wkbp41BwriC3gniN6fqzDg.text: Great experience and the service was great! The waiter had been worth Bally's since 1974 and made our experience enjoyable. Be sure to purchase the groupon; no restrictions on days and times for use. The steaks were great.

EEbpnTPEwyul9rSJfkq_Gw.text: Customer service was great, but food was ok. Steak was ok, and the mac m cheese are super salty!!' Price was too high

SSpuTkESyoz55n0q9tklug.text: High-End Steakhouse at Bally's?!?  Who Woulda thought?! Bought a Groupon for this restaurant and sooooo glad I did!! (I was informed that they are a newer restaurant on the strip and using Groupon to get more business & reviews). There were multiple other choices but my fiance and I hadn't tried this restaurant yet so we thought we'd give it a go. Food was excellent, service was excellent and they even did a special champagne toast as soon as we told the wait staff we were celebrating our recent engagement. We ordered the Porterhouse for two, split a Caesar salad & mashed potatoes and it was plenty of food and we even had leftovers. Definitely a hidden Gem!! We made made reservations , but it was a Monday night and it wasn't that busy and we didn't really need them. P.S. the fresh baked popovers are ridiculously amazing!!!

KUIBweDM3_bKXw1keu0mWA.text: Steak was cold and the service was very poor.  Our server (Omar) barely checked in on us. We frequently had to ask for help. There are better places to eat for the money.

gUDCBVivXP3zKf7ht3V7oA.text: My wife and I have lived in Vegas for 13 years and have been searching for the best steakhouse in Vegas.  We've finally found it at BLT Steak inside Bally's.  Truly the most flavorful steaks we've ever had combined with finely crafted cocktails and an impressive wine list.  This spot is a hidden Vegas jewel.  Consider yourself lucky to have found it!

mg_vaz9hAJ0PuE5jZO8A3A.text: I had the Ribeye and it was pretty good. Popovers were awesome. I also liked the atmosphere there. Sat at the bar, the service was a bit slow and bartender had his head down so couple people including myself had a hard time requesting things or getting the check for an extended period, otherwise, great!

ZP3A0QTuXB_Q504IBAUbVA.text: I see all of these positive reviews and my group of three, well, we won't be back to this location.  And it wasn't because of the food or the complimentary dessert bites because the food was indeed savory.  It was because of the waiter that serviced our table.  He was snooty and flat out rude.  My companions both ordered steak, it is after all a steakhouse and they received wonderfully prepared steaks that were quite large.  In fact large enough that you could take half of a piece home.  My husband and I shared one.  That is what got us "on the bad side" of the waiter.  But the truth is, neither of us could have eaten an entire steak ourselves.  And because I wasn't ordering my own meal, I was not entitled to water refills.  That's right you heard me, our waiter (not the busboy) would not refill my water glass when he filled my husband's glass and his colleague's glass.  In fact, the waiter would not acknowledge my presence whatsoever.  As a result he had 3 very unhappy, unsatisfied customers that felt he did not deserve a tip.   The bus boy was my personal waiter and we did tip him privately and the hostesses were polite and kind.  The three of us vowed not to return.  Next time we'll walk over to Paris and try Gordon Ramsey Steak as we know the steak will be just as good but perhaps the manager does a better job ensuring how his customers are treated by his staff.  Oh, and just so you know, the steaks were $50 a piece, if you wanted potatoes you paid an additional $10, if you wanted vegetables, you had to pay an additional $15.  If you do not order dessert the chef will send out a spoon-sized bite of dessert to top off the orders (in our case we received two, but that's fine by husband doesn't do sweets).  That was a classy touch, but I am sure it is meant to encourage you to change your mind and order dessert.  Had we received better service we would have ordered two desserts, one for myself and one for my husband's colleague.  We spent over $160 on dinner and had very little customer service at the table (the waiter seemed to be avoiding us altogether) So it goes to show, how the waiter treats the customer does impact how much the party is willing to spend and whether they will return or recommend to friends.  In our case, the recommendations are to avoid BLT Steak at Ballys!

_cENACE1uQ06XSqF-MmBnQ.text: My girlfriend and I were looking for a steak dinner to celebrate the night after completing the rock n roll half. We were staying at Flamingo and wanted close. I was hesitant to go to Ballys as it comes off as "old" but BLT had great reviews. We both got the Filet with truffled mash and Brussel sprouts, all of which were amazing. Our servers were very friendly and attentive which added to the experience. It was the perfect mix between casual and dressy. I would definitely recommend this to anyone not looking to pay crazy amounts for a good steak.

gXk-g8qdz3LMFyz9CrDl_Q.text: Just had dinner with a party of 6.  The restaurant was not busy at all, however, we waited for 30 minutes to be seated.  Once seated, we were waited on promptly.  After placing our order, they never came back to refill our water glasses or see if we wanted anything else. We ate our dinner with no beverage.  The food itself was delicious.  The meat was cooked perfectly and the appetizers were great.  We were disappointed with the service.  4 guys standing around monitoring service but not one of them pitching in to ask us if we needed anything.

bCuFTET5faybdtARpGl9Vw.text: BLT is a great improvement over the old steak house in Ballys, the atmosphere is very cosmopolitan, the lighting just right, there is a welcoming round bar at the entrance, once seated a chefs sample appears, the service was attentive , food was flawless, but a bit pricey. Expect a $75 per person tab if you have a drink or wine.  Recommended

fkCs4UqzNGSdebWcANKIeQ.text: A good steakhouse on the strip.  The BLT brand has yet to disappoint me.  This place is kind of hard to find, its tucked in the back of Ballys, which already sits far back off the strip.  The steaks were cooked perfectly, and sides were excellent.  It is worth coming here just for the popovers.  People rave over the, but they are merely a vessel for the Vermont Creamery Cultured Butter.  Its like you have never eaten real butter before.

photos.caption: Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled Mashers
Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye
Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed Spinach

LJY6B8AKkGfQfzZf3TfNSw.text: This was the worst dining experience I have ever had! Everything started great. Excellent amuse, great pop overs and great salad too but when it came to the porter house it was terrible! I'm a chef and have worked in several high end steak houses as the broiler chef. This porter house $96 would have never been served at any establishment I have ever been to or worked for. The steak was cut before it was cooked because the waiter forgot to ring it in so they cheated and it came out terrible. We told the waiter nicely and he told his manager. We waited and ate around the raw (not rare, raw) meat while waiting. We had a show to get to and couldn't wait another 30 minutes for another steak.He came over 20 minutes later and gave us a 20 percent discount? We didn't even eat 20 percent of the steak!  We were very disappointed and believe Gordon Ramsey is a fake. There are many other places to dine on the strip but will never waste our time in another one of your restaurants.

eG_QlTCGNIYVffeM0IWK8w.text: This restaurant is now my favorite in Las Vegas. Everything was perfect, from the food to the service. The appetizers they bring you are outstanding, especially the duck and jam pate.  My short ribs were amazing and my husband's bone in rib eye was so tender that he didn't need a knife. A special kudos to Tracy, the manager and Sergio who was our server. Rarely do I take the time to post on yelp but this place was so excellent!

GXXC6c7PukHi4lOyOphsIw.text: My porterhouse was really good! Also the cream spinach and the truffled mash were good. Too bad the location at Ballys isn't that great, not as lively and trendy like STK and other steakhouses in Vegas.

Ihq0hzPlh1Xzls14g6e99w.text: OMG!  The absolute best steak I have ever had!  Everything was great from the before-dinner drinks to the appetizers to the sides to the STEAK!  Table-side service by Leslie was great!  We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall of wine!

_TTv7-c2YSDQfafpPjQuGw.text: If you want to be spoiled..dine at BLT Steak @ Bally's Las Vegas. It was amazing and ask for Javier he will take care of you. dinner was amazing. I have to say besides the  veal chop and the Mac and cheese, the best thing that was served was the complementary duck pate with sliced salami on the side..FANTASTIC. After the meal was finished, our server then surprised us with 2 cake pops and 2 bite size brownies. if your looking for a great steak house in Vegas..I highly recommend BLT Steak at Bally's hotel.

osOA5dXG2SkTVMOIZw1ztg.text: If you want a popover - fine! If you want a steak - go somewhere else. I was tempted to leave it only one star but we have to have leeway for more terrible restaurants, thought that is hard to imagine.  The main complaint: the steak was not quite warm and certainly never got hotter. They serve the steak in what appears to be a cast iron skillet. One would imagine that this could keep the meat at a desirable eating temperature, but not if it was not warmed initially, nor the steak was hot when placed in the skillet. When serving, they place a dab of butter on the steak and ours was so cool that the butter never fully melted, just got limp a bit.  Next, they promote the steak as being prime - I sincerely doubt it. Aside from the sinew running through it, a good portion of it, the fat layer on the outside was much too large. Now, Prime connotes a certain degree of fat, that is what makes it prime, but that is fat that is in the meat, marbling, not a half inch or more around the outside that did nothing to enhance the taste or flavor. It was Saturday night,and they were not busy - with good reason!. There is a discount coupon available at Tix4tonight that will save you 30% (on the food only - shortsighted) and it is still not worth it. The oysters were good, and with the discount reasonable.  I could go on and complain about the service, the creamed spinach and there were some good points, but so over weighed by the bad, that I will not go there - nor should you. .

RE_3qF5FVSRNKZcud8uaPg.text: I could write a bunch of how incredible the food and service was but I will keep it simple..... THIS IS A MUST!!!!! Just go!  1 piece of advice is most likely split a steak unless you have a place to store leftovers.

pWBKdrWQJKLS-beejt530A.text: Awesome high quality food.  :Love the selection and the cocktails are delicious! Staffs thinks ahead and beyond, fantastic guest service.  Love the fact that everyone looks like they wanted to be there and taking care of guest needs is important.

photos.caption: Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WEAhq8AsG_hifvrM8g-4tA.text: I was hoping to get a better steak at a place like this in Vegas. We ordered the New York strip and it was let's say not the best steak I have ever had. It was a very thick cut of meat and not very tender. Our server Mike was awesome and give us a free desert and a discount. I would come back and try a different steak and most like would be a different experience.

h1LXtZWJZFW0_esOzSO92Q.text: (Bar review only)  I went last night (Saturday) during happy hour. They had some decent seating left so I had to check it out. I had a great bartender name Robert tending to me and he made me three awesome drinks.  I started off with the mule then  The blt cocktail: bulliet bourbon, lillet blanc,  house ginger syrup,  lemon juice, orange bitters, topped w/ elderflower tonic  And then Robert recommended the old cuban: appleton v/x rum, lime juice,  brown sugar syrup, angostura bitters, mint leaves,  topped w/ champagne  For 7 dollars a drink you couldn't beat the value and service! Thanks I will see you guys again soon!!

OWIeKXww6ac4hcj1t7YsLw.text: After our disastrous visit to the Gordon Ramsey steakhouse, it was a delight to find stellar service and fabulous food at BLT Steak.  The popovers were, expectedly, warm, buttery and delicious. What we did not expect were the additional duck liver raspberry pate, mini-pizza slices and assorted meat plates that the chef sent over simply by being a Diamond Rewards card member. Good thing we forgot to order the Tuna Tartare that we had our eye on!  The 28 day-aged Ribeye did it disappoint. Perfectly marbled with gooey fat and lightly charred to make the spices dance in your mouth. It was a good thing we decided to taste the Short Ribs after the ribeye because, seriously, this dish is the star of the night. Melt in your mouth, fork tender, buttery ... Oh la la. Our server, David, was on the money when he said the short ribs were probably the best thing on the menu. I would visit BLT Steak again for this dish alone.  With no more room left for dessert, we were again pleasantly surprised when the chef sent over another two complimentary plates: peanut butter jelly and passion fruit pops + brownie bites. A fantastic end to a delightful culinary inclined night.

jRUGXwmmikG-GMGgmEuRCQ.text: This could be the best steak I've ever had. From the moment we entered, we felt a certain calm and harmony about this place. We stopped at the bar first. There is a happy hour from 4 to 6 every day and the cocktails are exceptional. Regarding the dinner, our food was prepared perfectly and presented beautifully. The steaks were prepared exactly as we asked. This chef is exceptional and the general manager runs this place just right. It is a hidden oasis in Vegas and deserves much more of your attention. Don't miss this place!

LEpTzDSiV4XWqD0L4oyBtA.text: The duck liver mousse takes a distinct palate to like it. However, the bone-in NY strip was great, the butter added a great flavor. Of course the popovers were amazing.

Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

euvlETsHSjJ4EWnllIbivg.text: Didn't have a steak because our reservations were too late, and had a tummy ache. My husband wanted the 28-day dry aged NY Strip but waitress convinced him to have the Bone-in Strip. He had it with peppercorn sauce and he loved it. When I ordered the shrimp cocktail waitress made a face. That disappointed my husband and wanted to walk out. Other than that enjoyed the popovers and baked potato and the asparagus were amazing!! Loved the VIP platter that they bring to the table to try. Duck liver wasn't too bad. I only wish my wine was chilled when served. Not sure if we'll return but it was an "OK" experience!

EX5FkEjfU1Ty5A9JBmnoxg.text: There is a male bartender here that needs to find a new gig. If you are ever at Bally's and choose to check out this new, trending place thanks to Hell's Kitchen and sit at the bar, you will know what I mean. If he is working. Just our menus and a drink please fella, hold the attitude. You are not so above working here. However, a gal that was newer on bar was amazing, saved the night and resumed our confidence to order (She gets 5 stars). She was under a sharp eye, training to make specialty drinks and asked if we could be her testers. UM, SURE! We tried almost all of the specialty cocktails on the menu and none of them were bad. Enjoyed them all. Especially the blackberry mule. Food coming out to others looked amazing - burgers, steaks, onion rings in tower form. I hope this new, friendly, female bartender stays on here. She was super grateful for her job and and saved our visit by doing it well with a smile. I hope she got our $$ tip but likely not, sadly. Try the original, sinful pan bread they bring out before your order (so good they hand you the recipe with the bread!) and the beet salad. Very good.

photos.caption: Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We kept getting treated to drinks like this! An elevated  blackberry mule, yum!
Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted beet plate

I4oAjbISEmzbwBdn2dH_Gw.text: I was out here in mid-December for my birthday with a bunch of friends, one of which found this place.  While we did use a groupon, we were also drinking and very friendly, as was our server, so the few reviews that mentioned this to be an issue, I think may be outliers.  Sides were great, service was top notch, steak was cooked to my specifications and had a really fantastic taste.  The server, bus team, and hostess were all great, now, I realize that 2 weeks before Christmas is off season, but I'm not in anyway going to hold that as the only reason they were great to us...I think it was because they're really good at their jobs, and, well, I'm fun, LOL.  Still not sure if the happy birthday plate was my brother or he just gave them a heads up and did this.  Either way, I had a great time, and ate some great food with some great family and friends.

PljsUZDpeLP3Ui7Lc_NxRg.text: Service was outstanding! Had a travelzoo voucher was way too much food but was fun to order whatever we wanted. Keep in mind you still have to pay tax and tip.   Popovers A+ Liver pate B+ Tuna tartar A+ burrata B Lobster Salad B+ Ribeye B outside was too burnt for me at Medium rare Chimichuri sauce F way to spicy not edible Do not get this never tasted chimmichuri like this Banana Cream pie A Complimentary desserts A Drinks B

YrVkNzqx4UdVL-jDnetAig.text: I went last night for dinner with my sister and father. The service was quick and the food was wonderful. I had the filet mignon medium well which melted in my mouth just the outside was a little burnt. The mashed potatoes and the creamed Spinach were very tasty. Overall a good dinner service and very attentive customer service.

aD-Prax2DrPQyjdhcEUISw.text: BLT is located inside Bally's, one of the older hotel casinos.   The menu is ala cart. I had the bone-in ribeye. $60. Was it worth it? Well, consider the meat is excellent, the steak was large and this restaurant comes with all the pretense of a high-priced steakhouse, yeah, sure, if you want to treat yourself.   I also got a baked potato which was the size of a small football. They must be growing these is some of abandoned nuclear test sites nearby. Total meal price: $90  I found the wall bench seating and the table height out of sync. The table was so high I felt like I was back at the kids table at Thanksgiving. I had to reach up to keep my sleeves out of things and kept knocking things over. I noticed the same thing at another Bally's restaurant. It seems to be an overall design flaw.   I thought it was funny that you are given a complimentary "popup" I believe they called it. It's really just Yorkshire Pudding (flour, water baked in hot oil until it puffs out).   So it's a good place for a treat. It's highbrow for Bally's. Be careful ordering too much. The serving sizes are big.

mM8AHye5RRPeWfQuvj8wZQ.text: Great food great service A little pricier than my usual steak but OK for Vegas prices I would come back

L3P2l8bH3YngLrI4XzRXSg.text: Excellent food, excellent service.  Pleasantly surprised having known about this a la carte steakhouse for many years.    Pretty flawless experience.  My mom and I had a hundred dollar credit.    No one could dine with us and we are light eaters.  Decided to splurge at the steakhouse.   The steaks were a bit pricey even for a la carte, but the filet was a large 10 oz only, so we ordered one and split it w a side of mashed potatoes and the Mac n cheese.  We also ordered the spinach bacon salad.    We were presented with a compliments of the house bite size appetizer and then was presented with a charcuterie plate of four meats and a duck pate for our diamond status.  We were not expecting this and would have saved for desert instead of sides and salads.  But very good and very nice.   I didn't like the duck pate at all.  I am sure it was very nice though.  Lol.    Steak was excellent, albeit we ordered medium and it was very medium rare (which made me happy anyway, not the mother).     The sides were both very tasty, although on the small side for $12.  If we were not light eaters, they were not sharable, which is entirely too pricey.   Mashed and Mac are just mashed and Mac after all.    The only main criticism would be the salad it was a fail.  It needs removed from menu.  The Flavors were not there, the dressing was nonexistent.  The flavors came from the very good, but bulky and almost jerky like chewy inch squares of bacon and the also very good when you had some blue cheese.   However, eating some jerky bacon before a nice steak kind of defeats the purpose of a smooth steak.  We had decided we had entirely too much food anyway and had them box it for my husband.  It was edible, but paired poorly and executed poorly.    Ahh, forgot the popovers.  We were also served two huge hot and fresh popovers before the salad.     Drinks were filled continuously, yet no staff were overbearing.  Plates were cleared and table was kept timely and throughout.     Honestly, for a very good quality meal and a lot of meal we were at $100 for two people.  Although again we ordered one entree by design.   We would never eat two steaks and still brought half of one home for my husband.  I would actually recommend or return to this steakhouse again if needing to entertain or a special occasion.

3deiJKghG2ZV8tHk8P_IgQ.text: We used to go to the BLT in LA and loved it. We decided to try BLT in Vegas and see how it compared to the old BLT. It was very close and still very good. Service is always top notch here and they seem to anticipate every need. The popovers are fun and very tasty. The ahi tartar is fresh and very good. The streaks of course are good and finish with the carrot cake! The place is darker then normal and I love that, gives it character.

mejz1hxThAkAPfj9pWDNDA.text: It's an OK steakhouse. We stayed at Bally's and was debating between Old Homestead Steakhouse (Caesar's)  and Center Cut (Flamingo's). Concierge at Diamond Club told us she likes BLT the best so we went for it. Interior decor wasn't anything to write home about. Everyone was very friendly - from the hosts to waiter to wait staff. We shared a bone in strip- it arrived already cut up in pieces which was interesting. It tasted fine. Also ordered stuffed mushroom caps and asparagus- both were fine. My husband did like the popover bread- raves about it.  We usually go to Morton's for steak at home in Denver and I felt the food here was not as good- just fine. No flavors really stood out.

VN3TfSIAMmsSHrgXnYU0IA.text: The BEST banana cream pie ever. The popovers are fabulous and they even give you a recipe! The only thing I could complain about was the coffee - a little weak.

uECOe6M7QBSNQeccuqoiqQ.text: Fantastic experience with an offer from Travel Zoo. Service by Javier and Oscar- impeccable. Good timing perfectly. Ordered crab cakes, Caesar salad, filet, and truffle mash and it was absolutely delicious. I know it's a little hidden in a corner, but absolutely worth it!

frMFtby6aeYZX_CN7Nsctw.text: Invited for the mock service.  Hugo was our server for the evening and he was great along with all the managers who stopped by our table to make sure everything was super-de-duper.  Drinks: Watermelon Basil which is what I was going to order (Ketel, Cointreau, Muddled Watermelon and Basil).  Hugo recommended the Got My Mojo Workin': I wasn't crazy about the thought of Ginger Green Tea in it but it was delicious! (I ordered two!)  The Cool Woodford was NOT our cup of tea but then again we aren't really bourbon drinkers - it was QUITE strong!   Chef Compliments: Duck Liver Pate with Port Jelly was salty and not bad tasting.   Popover bread with Gruyere cheese wasn't the best for either of us but interesting with the cheese baked right in the bread. I did like the crispiness of the bread with the light cheese taste, butter and sprinkled salt.   Salad: Lobster Salad was SO good! Like SOOO good!! Big pieces of lobster in a Cobb style salad with crispy bacon, half a soft boiled egg, crispy onion straws, different types of lettuce and a delicious house made  Buttermilk Ranch dressing - this could actually be a light meal or almost too much as a starter salad because of all the goodies in it! Just pick out all the lobster and other good stuff and leave the lettuce behind... I MOST DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS SALAD!  Bibb Salad w/Manchego cheese, beets and a Mustard Vinaigrette was tasty as well - better for a starter for dinner and less filling than the Lobster salad.  Mains: 2lb Lobster from Maine: poached AND grilled to retain its juciness. I love seafood and this was juicy and delish! I MOST DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS ENTREE! I pretty much ate it ALL all by myself!  Waygu Rib eye: Ordered medium rare was cooked perfectly. The flavor was very good, crispiness on the outside but chewey and flavorful. A little salty for me, but some people enjoy theirs more on the salty side.  Desserts/After dinner drinks:  Crepe Souffle: passion fruit, fluffiness, sweetness, tartness and with the burnt sugar to boot!   Warm Chocolate Tart w/ pistachio ice cream: Ummm I LOOOVED the pistachio ice cream!! The tart itself was a little bitter for me, I'm more of a milk chocolate type of gal but it was moist and rich on the inside.   Grand Cafe: Friend loved it.  Moscato D'Asti!!! Sweet and delicious!  Chamomile tea w/honey as if I wasn't already in a food coma, this will really help put me to sleep!  Everything was delicious and service was excellent from every staff member on the floor.

photos.caption: Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bibb Salad
Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool Woodford
Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popover w/Gruyere cheese

fmjtPjZlcfs86Iztxbs9wA.text: Not bad for a steak joint up in Bally's!  I sat at the bar dining alone that night.  The bartender and servers were very attentive and never once I felt pushed away.  I ordered me a glass of tempranillo; ding nice indeed.  I went with the hanger steak and side of potato skins.  They brought me some starters, which to my surprise were very good especially if you're a table bread person.  They're popover bread is no joke and pretty darn good along with some sea salt.  The hanger steak was perfectly cooked; nice and tender with a tab bit of a crush on the outside to give a crunch - Yum!    Overall, great experience and couldn't ask for anything more.  Great service and food! - Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7h-gVlgjGd_0nnRrPKAKog.text: I've been here for dinner as well as the brunch buffet. I'm reviewing this place for the buffet as it is my latest experience.  It's $125/person, so come hungry! It's a reasonable price given the quality of the food.   They have lobster tails, prime rib, pork belly, king crab, caviar, bass, braised short ribs--I cant even remember all the variety.  The meat was tender, the seafood was fresh, and the desserts were perfectly decadent.  The Cesar salad came separately dished, meats and cheese dishes were ready-to-go, and other sides such as personal whipped cream cups were also pre-prepared. I thought this was a thoughtful touch. It's more personalized rather than picking out your own salad from a large tray.  My husband and I sat at the bar because he didn't make a reservation... So make a reservation! We signed up for the waitlist at 10 and got seated at about 11:10 a.m.. I knocked a star for that, just because we had the impression we would be seated closest to 10:30 am

YuyJXaw0vfQ8S8AcKGukOw.text: Talk about an amazing meal!!! The meat was like butter! So perfect!  They served the lightest and fluffy bread with the best best butter!  We tried 2 cocktails and both were just to die for!!!!  BLT steak is big $$$ but worth every penny for an amazing meal!

photos.caption: Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks!
Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday desert!
Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and butter

xs_xhgycCyJPgAU8Iwd3Yg.text: In the past, I truly enjoyed dining here as well as the Hawaii location but on 8/24/19 I had the worst experience ever. Keep in mind this is not a one or two $ symbol.  With that said, I do expect exceptional service which our server did not deliver.   First choice of dining was Gordon Ramsey and Nobu but unfortunately they were all committed so since I originally had a great experience here, I decided to return here.   We were a party of 3. When we arrived no one was at the front podium. We waited for about 5 minutes and finally a female started running to the front to greet us. She said it would take another 5 minutes to seat us. Eventually a couple more hosts walked up to the front.   Our server greeted us a few minutes later and distributed our menus to us. He asked what kind of water we wanted; Pellegrino, Tap or Fiji. We said "option B" aka Tap and he says Fiji? He kind of gave us a little smirk.   Food:  *Smoked Bacon with Chimichurri Sauce *Tuna Tartare  *22 OZ Cowboy Rib Eye with Bone Marrow and Roasted Garlic *8 OZ Filet Mignon  *Sauteed Dover Sole *French Fries *Bottle of Meiomi Pinot Noir Complimentary popovers, charcuterie board, Duck Liver Pate and another dish that tasted like pizza. All were good and thank you for these tasters.  Our waters were never filled. I had to ask a few times.   Next, we ordered a bottle of wine and our food. He then says, they were out of Wagyu and something else. Which is fine. We ordered the 2 lb lobster and a couple of steaks. He then returned and told us they ran out of lobster so we needed to pick another dish which we did.  In addition to our order my friend asked for blue cheese for his steak.  The food was then delivered and NO Blue Cheese given.  He asked the server again which he responded with give me a minute and when he brought it, it was damn dressing. Errr, we had to ask someone else to get blue cheese. Finally,  the blue cheese crumble was given.    As far as the food, the Ahi was delicious. I would not recommend the bacon. That was extremely salty and I love salt. At least the chimichurri offset the salty taste.  The filet was cooked perfectly to my liking. Now, I ordered the Rib Eye Medium temperature.  The steak was medium rare. The server never came by to ask how we were doing and if the food was to our liking. So since I couldn't locate him,  i asked a female who was next to our table and luckily she was one of the managers on the floor. She apologized and said yes it was medium rare and would give us a complimentary dessert and champagne.  Nothing was delivered to us so whatever.  The server did not apologize at all for the incorrect cooking of the steak. We finally got our steak back and now the outside of the steak was burnt instead of nicely charred.  What a waste in my opinion.    Overall, my experience was a very negative one. I will no longer recommend BLT.  Now I know why BLT had available reservations and Nobu and Gordon Ramsey were fully committed.  This place really went downhill.

UH1bZdLVGBWyAc6HFA5UEA.text: Stumbled into this place because of convenience. Came to be a pleasant surprise. Great wine and food. I loved the Maytag blue cheese on top of the Wedge salad - great refreshment after a wild weekend in Vegas.

Iv8a74JHXjyMJZcYyJbNhQ.text: There were 5 of us to dinner this time. Each time I've been here it is wonderful. I am not sure why the market price for Dover sole ($70) was more than the bone-in ribeye ($65).   All the different salads were great but I'm so glad I shared mine. The Dover was good but for $70 their wasn't much. Since it is a steak house I will definitely order the steak next time.   The biggest reason I like the BLT is the buttered popovers (they even give you the recipe). I could make a meal of it.  Desserts are divine. Let's go back soon!

QAAFfPqI55NxZPopo13eSQ.text: This place is fantastic they start you off with great popoversi then had s tuna tartare which was superb  For my main course I had filet mignon which was like butter definitely recommend this restaurant

LwhUgP-vVqYesSudEnHJ9A.text: This steakhouse has a great ambiance. We had wonderful service. We got the filet mignon and Kansas cut. The filet was outstanding. The Kansas cut was flavorfully good but not as tensor and I would have liked it being medium rare.  We loved the truffle mashed potatoes.  The carrot cake with ginger ice cream was not what I expected. It was good but it was not anything like a traditional carrot cake that I am used to.  No regrets dining there but for my next visit to Vegas I will try another steak place as there are so many good ones there.

LXOaSz2BZi4b7FVkI_Z8Aw.text: Nothing too memorable for me to return. First off, the popovers they brought out to table were good but it would have been better if it came out hot instead of stone cold. The sides are sides. You should not  mess the sides up but their mac & cheese was the worst I've ever tasted. Nothing but salty bites. Pasta was cooked perfectly but the sauce was just wrong. Maybe it was my mistake for ordering it. Should have stuck to veggies. The chopped salad was cold and refreshing but wasn't a big fan of the dressing either which was also on a saltier side. Baked potato was huge and comes with the condiments (sour cream, butter, shredded cheddar, & smoked bacon). The filet mignon was cooked to the temperature requested and the quality was very good. The Porter House Cut though, was so disappointing. Porter house or T-bone steak if you will, has to be the king of their cuts. I was expecting a very good tasting cut of meat. The appearance was good with the roasted garlic on the big cast iron plate. The done-ness wasn't our desired temp though. The temperature was all over the place. Some parts done right, some parts were so over and some parts were rare. Chewy and rubbery mess. The herbed butter couldn't help to make the meat taste better either. Let's just say, our pup even refused to eat the left overs we brought back from here. The meat was overall not so satisfactory but we decided not to mention it (more like why bother). With the rave reviews, maybe my expectation was set too high.  Service was good, friendly & attentive.  Well, there are endless steak dinner options in Vegas. Off to search for another place! **the check in offer is actually buy one get one free offer!

KrYFtOM4S8oAGuZ0b-9h9w.text: I've been on a search for the best steak in Las Vegas. My go to used to be N9INE Steakhouse, but sadly, they closed. We arrived to an energetic, but not stuffy dining room of patrons. Our waiter was professional and friendly. Though, his demeanor did change when alcoholic beverages were not initially ordered. Interesting that he lit up like a Christmas tree when we later opted for wine.  The steak offerings here a huge. The New York strip is 20 Oz. The Ribeye, 22oz. And, the filet - 10oz. We opted to share the 22oz "Cowboy" bone in ribeye. The presentation was very nice. However, sadly, it was tough and rubbery. We sent it back. Our server gave us complimentary rounds of wine and beer as a way to make amends. That was nice. Second time around, the steak we ordered to be medium well came back as medium-it was primapink, but we didn't want to complain. The steak was good, but there are much better steakhouses in Vegas. For now, Golden Stein and Circus Circus still reign supreme...at least, for me.  I won't return.

ZZsYFLs8OoMwxAxJBcY7HA.text: I've been wanting to go here but didn't expect it to clear my 5 star requirements. We ate dinner at the bar and was served by Mike and another gentleman. They were attentive. The complimentary bread was amazing. It was almost croissant like. Soft in the inside, sweet, and excellent. Our steak... oh my. The steak, cooked medium was extremely tasty. There was no need for the peppercorn sauce that we purchased. Next time, I would get it medium/medium well instead but still no complaints.  The green beans were a good compliment and the starter lobster salad excelled. It was enough for the both of us unlike the salad at Gordon's (still mad about that) Anyways the salad was tasteful, but I must add that it was a bit too salty. Didn't have any drinks this time but we can't wait to go back for a few. See ya next time BLT.

photos.caption: Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t6AkF25FGRd7UuKlDTkEUA.text: I don't think I would have dined at this place if it wasn't for my hotel room key, I must say, it was a great find.   I was staying at Bally's and was about to head out. I was searching everywhere for my room key and all I found was this ad with a picture of a popover. It took me a while to realize it's actually my room key and not some ad I received from the lobby at registration. It had been a while since my last time munching a popover. And I had a 20% off coupon from staying at Bally's. Why not?   So I went in for an early dinner. Over ordered for a party of 1 like always. I know I should have chosen a smaller cut, but I'm a sucker for ribeye. So here comes a 22oz bone-in ribeye seasoned with salt and pepper with a slab of herb butter. What I didn't expect was the bone marrow that came with my steak. I felt bad about eating so much meat, so I ordered brussel sprouts on the side to have a well balanced meal.   After I ordered, I was served with some crostini with duck liver pate spread. I love pate, but I was lowkey sad. I thought the ad on my room key was a lie. I came for popovers with a side of steak. Did they changed it out for the pate? So here I'm trying to look extremely normal while being all upset inside. But the spread was pretty good. I must say, it's not enough crostini for that spread they give. On one hand, I wanted to save some room for my steak (knowing that I will take home at least half). On the other hand, I just wanted to eat the pate straight from the jar. As I was working on scooping more pate onto my crostini, MY POPOVER CAME!!!! The warm pastry that's extra soft inside with a hint of cheese is finally here, right in front of me, not just 2D on my room key. That's it, I'm gonna get full off of my pate and popover at a steakhouse. Done.  My steak and brussel sprouts came, my whole table was just packed with food. My eyes were definitely wider than my stomach. My steak was so crispy on the outside but so juicy and just right (had it medium rare). Just stick to the basics, I ordered a side of chimichurri sauce too, which was unnecessary. Sauce was good, but the steak alone was just flavorful. The brussel sprouts was the only disappointment that night. 99% of me thought it'd be fried. It came out just sauteed, soft textured, bit sour from the vinaigrette. Let's just say that I've had far better ones, even the ones I made at home tasted better than theirs. Maybe I should have gotten creamed spinach. Go fat or go home.   I had to take everything to go after like 3 bites. It wasn't because it didn't taste great, I just couldn't finish a piece of meat that's bigger than my face. But you bet that my 2 leftover meals (yes, it fed me 2 meals after) was pretty bomb. I'd come back for sure if I don't have any other meals planned (I'd be eating leftovers for a while).

X-8hsAPjrTV_2ClJgK1Dtw.text: This steak house is located inside Balleys. One of my favorite parts is the complementary duck liver, its just delicious! For our appetizer we got the East and West oysters which I will highly recommend. They are fresh and tasty. We also had the seafood platter for two which was good, but I would probably not order it again.   The service at this restaurant is great. The employees are very knowledgeable about their menu and make educated recommendations. We had the American Wagyu, the filet Mignon and new York steak. All of those steaks were perfectly cooked, tasty and tender. My favorite was the American Wagyu. For side dishes, I would recommend the mac and cheese or the truffle mash.   For dessert we have ordered the crepe souffle. At first it might look like an omelette but every bite was delicious. I love passion fruit so I was a big fan of the sauce. However, avoid this dessert if eggs are not your thing.

Hu8B438Rl1nr-rKHUL2UGw.text: This place was amazing! Checked in through yelp and received a free cocktail which was nice. They got us in before our reservation (we showed up early). Juan was very pleasant and funny. To start off we were given a Italian meat sampler, pate, and a yummy pop-up with home made butter, it was delicious!  We both ordered filets, which were perfectly cooked and sooooo delicious. We didn't get desert, but the chef gave us a little something sweet on the house.  This was a very pleasant experience, we will definitely be back the next time we are in Vegas!

AJT3Sdda-rZ--BtVaCrIRA.text: Delicious and high quality atmosphere. I have had comparable Lobsters for 1/3 of the price though...

9k74Kco_1Nnf4s8hnX08KA.text: The food here was phenomenal.  I had the ribeye which came with a nice bone on the side with a fork to scoop out the marrow.  The steak was perfectly seared on the outside and just the right temperature and color on the inside for a medium done steak.  The double cut bacon appetizer was great also.  Highly recommended

yHEAR0VJMV89O5I4TowftQ.text: I came here and sat at the bar which had a full menu. I wasn't sure what to expect as the restaurant was fairly new. The bartenders were very friendly and professional and once I informed them that I would be dining that night, they set up a full spread for service. I ordered after having a cocktail and they sent out the popper which was quite good. Chef also sent out a complimentary appetizer which was also very good. The shrimp cocktail that I ordered came out timely and was delicious. Between courses my water glass was constantly filled with great service from the staff.   My main course was the Maine grilled lobster which was excellent. I ate it all with a loaded baked potato - very good. Chef sent out a comp dessert which put me over the top. I would eat here again for the lobster but I would likely try more steakhouses if craving beef. Overall it was an excellent high end dining experience.

V6OVWvYA1j8BXWYnyyRcWA.text: Wait time, service and Steak was perfect. Recommend that you buy the coupon for $3 to get 30% off prior to going.

8Fv4OJdkLAF1OxlUgYRZJA.text: Our experience was outstanding and I don't say that lightly as a frequent traveller.  We sat at the bar and the staff was a complete stand out.  We usually eat at the location in Atlanta but the food and staff was a cut above!  Lots of good restaurant options in Las Vegas but the staff made the experience exceptional and that level of genuine service isn't something you can easily find.  Make sure to try the new cauliflower gratin.

6LX2L4UqNpE30vkRuvgp-g.text: We absolutely LOVED the BLT steakhouse!! First off I want to say our waiter Jeff was such a great waiter!! He was very busy (considering its Memorial Day weekend) but he worked his butt off at constantly checking up on us and answering any question we had. This was our first time to eat there and it was great! I had the filet mignon with the red wine sauce and my husband had the 24oz bone in ribeye with the blue cheese sauce. We also ordered the mashed potatoes and Mac 'n cheese as our sides. The Mac 'n cheese is awesome!!! I'm not a blue cheese fan but my husband said it was good but he liked my red wine sauce a little bit better. The popover rolls were incredible and I love that they give you the recipe! Last but not least, I had the Spirit Church Cocktail which was very yummy!!!! I didn't get a picture of our food but I got one of my drink which I will post. I wasn't sure if I would like it at first but it for sure exceeded my expectation! A+++

photos.caption: Photo of BLT Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sprit Church Cobbler

0BQkPTZ8OnDjAZeWUHlfHg.text: Unbelievable. Popovers are amazing! Even if you hate brussel sprouts, I dare you to order them! They are incredibly sweet and savory! I had the lamb, smaller portion than the filet mignon but so delicious!

JUle6Dyj91g5F4xOOoCz1Q.text: Believe the reviews - this place is the BEST!!!  Starting our stay here at BLT Steak set the tone for the entire weekend stay at Bally's, which was nothing less than awesome!  The awesome service provided by Larell and Bia was second to none.  If you appreciate great service with good food, this is the place - Thank you Larell and Bia!!!  Hope to see you again soon ;-)!!!

yG8DIhIsOR5ZXnWGUsDAKQ.text: Best meal we ever had! No kidding. The bone-in rib eye was cooked to perfection with amazing flavor. The 2lb lobster was out of this world and the oysters were incredibly fresh and tasty. My husband and I couldn't stop talking about the meal days later.

kU_N8Kuj3sAYizsmof9C9g.text: Am impressed with the service  of allie and jim. Perfection. Will absolutely return for more! Filet is excellenf, nice char, great flavour. Great service. We will be back. The bartender is awesome, wish my husband remembered his ,name, Great drinks, Great food, amazing service. Repeat. customer for sure. Thank you foe everything! Allie And Jim are fantastic.

r_wMtpua9tDTfdlH9i8jaw.text: I ended up at BLT Steak because I waited too long to make a reservation at Gordon Ramsay Steak, but it was a fine mistake in retrospect. The meal started off by our waiter bringing out a complimentary duck liver mousse which was very nice and of course the popovers which I found delightful. The popovers were light and airy and a great change of pace to the run of the mill bread baskets you tend to see. I shared a salad with my dining companion after that and then it was the steaks. I had the 32 ounce porterhouse and they had the filet. The porterhouse was right up there with the best steaks I've ever had, tender, juicy and full of flavor. The filet was equally tender, but lacked a little of the flavor of the porterhouse and while that might be enough for some to bump it to 4 stars, the quality service coupled with one of the handful of best steaks I've ever had is enough for me to give 5 stars.

ObpncHubUNrmXAfoABiKiQ.text: What a nice surprise.. Cancelled our Flemimgs reservation so we would not have to drive and had one of the best dinners ever at Ballys where we are staying.  Steak was cooked perfect and well seasoned.  The popovers were awesome.  Dessert was a warm chocolate tort and really finished off the meal. The server was friendly and attentive.  We would absolutely recommend this place.  You will not be disappointed.

1jziZdMOLoEBK8cejR8VsA.text: Excellent food, great service. Omar, our server, was outstanding. Would recommend the restaurant, and him specifically, to anyone. Thanks for a great night!!!!

QO6Y4fUezYM2kcG1Jn_VEQ.text: The popovers were a great start to a delicious meal! Everything was cooked to perfection. My wife had the lobster which was excellent, according to her one of the best she's ever had.. Our only complaint is that the staff was a little "stuffy"... lighten up, you're in Vegas!

8W6QWtiF4SgaKx1kei_GuA.text: My husband and I were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary there last Saturday, August 29th. Order the boned rib eye medium rare. It was cooked right but the meat was tough, chewy & dry. Very disappointed. Also, they didn't even give us an anniversary dessert. My friends went there a week before and their experience with the beef was the same. I would definitely not go back. Should have stuck to our Ruth Chris reservations!!

p5HXSirYE4mjjtJGSgx8cQ.text: Rib eye was great, the steak sauce was awful... one of the worse housemade steak sauces I've tasted.  Had this sweet tang to it... tasted like cheap bbq sauce.  Fortunately the steak had no need for steak sauce.   Lobster was a bit on the mushy side but had good flavor. The popovers were good but I dont understand this "OMG best bread ever!" claims. The fries were very disappointing.  When you charge $10+ for sides they should be special and worthy of that price tag.  Envy's Parmesan truffle fries and Whiskey creamed corn come to mind immediately.  These fries were not special at all and I tasted stale cooking oil on them.   The service was good but the waiter was overbearing with his push to get us to order drinks, appetizers, desserts. Here is one such exchange we had: Waitor: what would you like to drink? Me: water is fine, thank you Waitor: are you sure, we have some nice cocktails Me: no thank you, Ive had enough alcohol already today Waitor: well we also have some nice non-alchoholic drinks Me: no thank you, I have not drunk enough water while I have been in Vegas

p8wzzyW0Y3Y9iC8jAjxYzg.text: Amazing! The best filet mignon I have ever had. I've had the filet mignon at Ruth's Chris, Mortons, Smith and Wallensky, McCormick and Schmicks, The Palm.. you get the idea. I've been to all of them and I always order the filet. The filet at BLT is by far the best I have ever had. It was so tender and flavorful, I can't wait to go back to BLT at Bally's in Las Vegas. To start I had the bacon. I thought it was strange to order bacon for an appetizer but I did no wrong. It was like eating a steak but it was bacon!! It was so good and lean and tasty I wish I could get this bacon on a daily basis.  I might have a heartattack at some point if I did but I would die happy. Almost forgot.. As we sat down the waiter brought an amuse bouche which was a duck mousse pate with crackers. It was really nice but my highlight was the bread at the beginning. What a surprise! They call it "poppers". It was like eating a croissant but with a hint of cheese. I know when a restaurant is good and will be a great experience when the bread at the beginning is delicious. Let's just say everything else after the bread was just getting better. I don't know how but it did. I was so excited after ordering dessert (apple pie) I couldn't help calling a couple of people to tell them how amazing dinner at BLT was. When the bill arrived our server brought a small free dessert like a chocolate chip brownie bite. I tried one and even that was decadent.  The price at BLT might be a bit expensive (worth every penny) but you do get an little freebie at the beginning and at the end. And that makes up for the price difference between this steakhouse and all the rest not to forget to mention again the quality and flavor in my opinion surpass all other steakhouses. Don't think about it twice... choose BLT, it is amazing food and great service with friendly staff.

N_GFVnq3OtE8_tQ9hOZodg.text: Not even close to NYC. I know, it's Vegas, but this place needs work. Just find another steak joint that's been around. There are plenty. Some are even as good as their eponymous origins...Insult was $11 for fries that McD would be proud and might call their own...Some of the dishes are way too over-seasoned with just too many sauces, dips, etc...Pass on this for now...

TnoiAPeSfn9cQagZLGj6Cw.text: Beware of wine prices. My mom, sister and I sat at the bar while waiting for our table at a neighboring restaurant.  We were given a wine book with prices and ordered 2 glasses of wine and a beer.  The prices in the book ranged from $16- $35, so we thought that reflected bottle prices.  When we got our bill it was $70.00!  We just about crapped!  Each glass of wine was $29.00!  SO, if you're ordering wine, make sure you clarify if it's by the glass or bottle.  I have NEVER EVER seen wine by the glass for that much.  Obviously it exists, but shocked nonetheless.

Efdw5F1DB_xV4A2uxUidTg.text: Larell, Stephanie and Bia were incredible bartenders. They truly made the experience one of a kind. The food was amazing.  Double smoked bacon,  tuna tartar and duck liver (compliments of the chef)  were amazing.

S2pQJSIp-UG33kukwDz1_g.text: Ate here last time in Vegas, always looking for new places to visit while in town.  This is a definite, even though it is located in Bally's.  Service was excellent and the food was awesome.  We will definitely be back.

VoUYEEJxdxaEEJZmHuKNVQ.text: The food here was very good and priced accordingly. I put my self in a food coma after, but still  would recommend eating here. You can't go wrong with a bitch'n steak!

x4PlBYmcKwRH0WEx9AFqew.text: POPOVERS...at BLT Steak are so Delicious!. They even give you the Recipe to make at Home- an Extra Treat!  We had Wonderful Appetizers like the Tuna Tartare, Crabcakes and of course some Wine. Dinner was Exceptional with Generous Portions. The General Manager Lawrence was very Accomodating and made sure we were Pleased. Tammy was Helpful, Informative and Did a Fantastic Job making everything look so Pristine and Organized. Thank you for a Wonderful Evening at BLT Steak- we'll be back!

Dg2cBWsraTPM3pCjGMRqtA.text: Bartender had a major attitude problem. Artichoke was rock hard sent it back. When I brought it to bartender's attention he basically told me I was a liar and that I was the only person to bring this up. I had other people try it and they agreed it was too salty.
